name: Spiced Turnips (Shalgam Masala)
author: Kathleen Woods Rubino
summary: I love turnips. This Northern Indian dish is great way to spice up traditional mashed turnips. This dish is great garnished with fresh cilantro or parsley and served with basmati rice, or with naan bread. The amount of chiles you use really controls the heat factor in this dish.
ingredients: 2  small green chile peppers, seeded and chopped
directions: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
Add onion; cook and stir until soft, about 10 minutes
Stir in ginger-garlic paste and chile peppers; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Stir tomatoes, coriander, cumin, turmeric, and salt into the saucepan; mix well
Add turnips and hot water; stir well
Cover and bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer until turnips are tender, 20 to 30 minutes
Add brown sugar and coarsely mash the turnips
